Pros: People friendly and supportive envirnment. Pockets of extraordinary team work. Stronger Together!
Cons: No human organization is perfect, but this is a good one!

Review Title: Great Remote Work Opportunity - Fun Place to Work
Pros: Ability to work remotely, from 20 hours to 40 per week; that's terrific! Emphasis on individual learning, growth and career development. Work/life balance. Great benefits, including bonuses, health care benefit and 401 (k) plan matching (125% of contributions up to 6% of gross pay). Now 40 hours (1 week) of paid vacation per year. Some extra paid "recharge days" around the holidays. Freedom to build your own bookkeeping business on the side. Many of us do just that, and Intuit actually encourages it as long as you don't steal their Live Bookkeeping clients. That would of course be a conflict of interest. So I find this kind of job as a great opportunity to learn and become a QuickBooks Online Expert while building my own business on the side. Flexible schedule, but that requires Team Manager's approval.
Cons: Pay could be higher at the level of skill that they expect. But from what I understand there are raises and bonuses are supposed to be generous. No vacation used to be a con, but now select time employees at least get a week of paid vacation per year. And you can request unpaid time off during less busy periods.

Pros: Awesome benefits, consistent work, flexible schedules, tons of training & potential growth opportunities!
Cons:
Don't get too comfortable with a certain group of people you work with, Intuit loves to change things and move teams around. 

I have been on multiple teams since starting less than a year ago.

Co-workers can be very clique, very juvenile.

Management is very micro managy, and people who should be door greeters for box stores are leads (assist Management). 

Very difficult to get support for unique situations. 

Favoritism for some employees by Management and bad behavior goes unpunished. 

Metrics those are more important than the people closing the books.

I love the work I do, but it is very stressful. Have to adapt to numerous situations and still close books. Since starting, I now have high blood pressure issues. If you like to work with the same people, and do not care for change then I would look elsewhere for employment.

Review Title: Once know for Good WLB , currently one of the worst in Industry
Pros:
Good Perks and benefits. If not par, equivalent to whats Google and it peers offers. 
Do provide office cabs. 
Few teams are still exists, who have true WLB.
Cons:
In last 2-3 years, Indian management has putting in so much pressure on managers and Engineers and expectation is to work 24*7. Seriously, I am not at all joking.
Recently, we had Q&A with Indian Leadership and upon asking about WLB, it was told this is what how we are going to operate and each one of you will see the rigor and have to cope up with the work style.
Too much legacy code and maintainance task specially in billing team(former named as MSE now called as GTM-Tech).
A engineer has to do every stuff and has to run from pillar to post to get things done and won't find much help from peers and everyone trying to hold up their position and not comfortable sharing knowledge with colleagues .
There are very few teams and their top managers who still priotise employee well-being at first place but those are very few in India.
Being a current employee- One recommendation DON'T EVER PLAN TO JOIN INTUIT BILLING (MSE/GTM Tech TEAM) Otherwise you will regret on your decision like many of us who have joined the same team.

Pros: Good benefits. Great stock purchasing program. They are very good at talking a big game, but it feels like culture leftover from founder Scott Cook a long time ago, so now it feels like they're just going through the motions.
Cons: Pay is not great compared to peers. Promotion processes are convoluted. You need a director or above to sponsor your application. Extremely slow product development hampered by red tape and invisible gatekeepers. When they acquired the company I worked for, they threw tons of resources at switching our product to their One Intuit login. Last I heard, it's still in progress 3 years later. Their marketing is out of touch as well. They spent millions on a silly robot superbowl commercial while I worked there, it was awful. They also heavily lobbied congress for less tax filing rights for normal people (for their benefit). They committed to spend $500 million to put their name on an L.A. stadium while simultaneously firing hundreds of critical customer support workers in 2020 in the middle of COVID to outsource.

Pros:
Please note that this review is specifically for the Risk & Fraud teams on QuickBooks. Your experience may vary on other teams.

Pros include:
* Fair compensation
* Smart engineers
* Good tech infrastructure
* Very stable company
* Cool products
Cons:
* Very poor work life balance. The lights never turn off at this company. There are always people working, always messages flying around. I’ve seen engineers being asked to work late even when they’re sick. The work here comes first, then employees second. It's a very demanding environment.
* Can be very chaotic. Sometimes it feels like everything is “on fire". This is particularly true in the Risk & Fraud space, since fraud attacks can occur at any time, and thus require immediate attention from engineering.
* Many concurrent, tight deadlines leads to a stressful environment which results in many bugs in production. There's never enough time to go back and fix these bugs, since there's always a new, high priority initiative.
* The culture (or lack thereof) is not great here. There simply isn’t time to do anything else other than work on the next high priority initiative. 

The main issue with Intuit is that they prioritize speed over quality. If they would slow down a little bit, they would produce better quality features that result in less customer friction + allow their engineers to fix existing issues.

Review Title: QuickBooks Live Expert positions very different now
Pros: flexible hours and remote work, benefits at 20 hrs.
Cons:
More and more cons these days. Little to no control over job roles. New "expert" positions are nothing like the original QBO Live expert roles, bearing little resemblance to what one would consider a "bookkeeping" position. 
Experts are switched from platform to platform regardless of desire, abilities, skills, years of education, credentials, or career impact.
Bookkeeping tasks are being transitioned to outsourced workers. Current bookkeepers are being placed in customer service, call center help type roles, with more and more sales duties being added daily. (they boil their frogs slowly thinking none will be the wiser).
Intuit is better at shouting their newfound "values" than they are at abiding by them.

Review Title: False sense of “we are here for you”
Pros:
Great pay, benefits, and remote work.
If you keep your head down and do your job, you will be fine as long as you are not in management.
Cons:
Lots of work and not enough hours approved to complete it.
You will not know where you rank until it’s bonus time.
No one ever knows how the bonus is calculated or why you ranked how you ranked.
Every business unit functions differently (not for the better).
If you don’t do something game changing RECENTLY, you will never move up into a higher position and don’t take your time moving up because you will not get promoted after a while.
Popularity contest atmosphere.
You never know when you’ll get fired.
Leads want your job and will find a way to get it.
Leads are never satisfied - they find things to complain about.
Bonus is discretionary and will be reduced if the business unit numbers are not met.

Pros: Benefits, chance to work on innovative projects and use some cool tech at a fast pace.
Cons:
Many projects don't get the go-ahead or get pulled at the last minute due to resource constraints. There are more great ideas than there are people and systems.

Corners are cut in coding & testing leading to re-work.

Mobility moves are encouraged, but the reality is they are difficult to come by, and remaining in the current role can be limiting if you like a challenge.

Review Title: Great company, great leadership, high expectations
Pros: The company treats you really well, really high compensation, plenty of employee benefits such as WFM furniture, internet coverage, and a wellness stipend. The leadership is clear about what they want, and through regular meetings will make their vision known, allowing you to pivot to whatever you need to to achieve your individual goals while also staying aligned with the overall priorities. Feedback is helpful and consistent, and you are treated with respect. They hire you to be an expert in a specifc domain, and once you're done with training, you own that domain fully. Managers and leaders will defer to you, and you are expected to be able to stay on top of everything you own.
Cons: While it is nice to have the level of freedom we have in how we approach solving problems, sometimes a little more guidance would be appreciated. Also, promotions and raises seem to be hard to come by without basically interviewing for an entirely new position. Career growth is possible and encouraged, but takes a long time.

Pros:
A different experience of tech culture. You will get to work on various technologies. As a first timer to product company feels different to work on live product which is serving millions of customer. 

Nice leadership team. A good place to grow if you are skilled and talented at what you do.
Cons: Nothing in specific. Finding good till now

Pros:
Benefits-excellent benefits, Health Insurance, Life, vision, dental,
401K Matching
Yearly Bonuses
Paid time off-Recharge Weeks
Sick Time Accrual
Numerous avenues for training and promotion within
Cons:
Frustrating working with people who do not have the same work ethic. But this is with any company, not specifically Intuit. 

No other Cons

Review Title: Intuit is a decent company to work for, but not without flaws
Pros: Intuit is a well-known software company that offers products and services for accounting, tax preparation, and financial management. Intuit has a good reputation for being innovative, customer-centric, and socially responsible. Intuit also has a great work culture that fosters collaboration, diversity, and learning. Intuit employees enjoy flexible work arrangements, competitive pay and benefits, and opportunities for growth and development.
Cons:
However, Intuit is not a perfect company, and it has its share of challenges and drawbacks. Some of the common complaints from Intuit employees are:

Poor work-life balance: Intuit can be very demanding and stressful, especially during the peak seasons and product launches. Intuit employees often have to work long hours, weekends, and holidays, and deal with tight deadlines and high expectations. Intuit employees also report feeling burned out, overwhelmed, and underappreciated.
Political and bureaucratic

Review Title: Yes - It's really as great as the reviews say it'll be!
Pros: I was skeptical about the good reviews I'd seen and assumed the benefits were better-geared toward PT or FT team members but even as a select-time employee, I am blown away with the benefits. Not only is this paying significantly more than my last role, they've provided me with all equipment needed to do my job and I even get reimbursed for my internet expenses, which was just icing on the cake! There are so many opportunities to earn time-and-a-half pay and we are included in things like getting PTO for our birthday and the annual shut down week. To my surprise, even those benefits are more than I was expecting bc my normal work day is only a 6 hr shift but everyone gets paid for 8 hrs during that time! My leads and manager have been amazing to work with and even though you're WFH in this role, they still go above and beyond to make you feel included in a team. I am working my dream schedule and can take whatever time off I need without feeling chastized or having to come back from vacation to a mountain of work and I also don't have to be responsible to "cover" anyone else's shift if/ when they are out. I'm sure that could change depending on your role but for me, this is exactly what I wanted. There are no silly or stupid questions here and everyone is more than willing to go above and beyond to help you feel supported. I couldn't have made a better choice than to give it a try and put my hat in the ring for my dream job - I'm so glad I did!
Cons: You DO have to be willing to go with the flow, a bit. Because Intuit takes so much pride in improving as much as possible, there are some instances where there might be little notice to you, your leads or managers about things like a new training, a system update or the need to step up and help out another department. That being said, there is SUCH an emphasis put on the idea of "here is what we know, so far and we'll get through this as a TEAM" that you know you're not alone and it all works out. IMO, this keeps things interesting and allows you to learn new things you maybe wouldn't have put yourself out there for previously but I do see where this could be a bit off-putting for some people.

Pros: Good company with lot of benefits
Cons: Getting promoted is very difficult

Pros: I love the job. It's great if you want to work during the colder months of the year and have your summers off. Totally remote. Very flexible. Intuit invests a lot in training. Good equipment and great support. Pay is comparable to offers I got for local in office work. You can get up pretty fast from entry level to lead and even manager.
Cons: You never really know when you return in September or later in December if you are seasonal.

Review Title: Training Needs Help but Great Team to Work With
Pros: The team I am with is extremely supportive and helped me with any questions I have. I look forward to the daily huddles I can attend because the team insight is also helpful.
Cons: The training I went through focused more on the BOE role and less on the FOE role. Everyone in that training was going to be a FOE. I had to learn quickly on the job the things training didn't cover.

Pros: Several years as a Seasonal Expert - helping people get their returns ready, or preparing them for the less certain. This was a great career progression.
Cons: Pace can get a bit fast. Plenty of help to answer questions, still need to think on your feet, which is not for everyone.

Review Title: Great - if you like staying in your box.
Pros: Whether I would recommend Intuit to a friend largely depends on their priorities and what excites them. Intuit does offer fantastic benefits and general culture is open and inclusive. Earning potential is high. If you're a person who likes wearing a single hat and staying in your lane, you'll do great. If you're more of the type who likes to take risks, work beyond what you're asked and drive change, you'll be disappointed.
Cons: Agility, speed, risk and being willing to do the right thing are spoken but not truly part of the Intuit culture. Intuit does not provide opportunity for people who work beyond their job role. They'll gladly take advantage of it but don't expect to be recognized with job advancement. The people who go above and beyond by doing more than their role requires and challenging status quo, consistently say they feel their skills are eroding due to the limitations and lack of opportunity. Getting ahead at Intuit is more about being liked and who you know rather than the actual value you deliver. Change agents be ware of the cultural constraints. Intuit does not like people who challenge the status quo even when they agree with the direction.

Review Title: Not Challenging - Good for the Corporate Climber
Pros:
The Sydney office has a great view and is well equipped with standing desks. 
There’s some really good people who work here but they all tend to leave as it’s not challenging enough and too political.
If you play the game well you can get promoted but it’s a lot of jumping through hoops and playing the social game which may be for some but not those wanting to affect real change.
Cons:
A graveyard of ‘has-beens’ with very slow processes and old school ways of thinking. 
Makes it very hard to be motivated when you see a lot of smoke and mirrors to avoid doing any real work.

Review Title: Best company I ever worked for!!
Pros: Remote location, nice and fast company provided laptop, internet reimbursement, diverse environment, supportive manager and teammates, challenging, growth encouraged, loads of career potential, excellent benefits, greatly valued, included, trusted, encouraged to learn and be creative, generously rewarded with pay and bonuses, I've worked for some top companies in my career. Intuit is by far the BEST!! I'm valued, challenged, and feel free to express my opinion and ideas. Loads of potential on this technology forward (innovator) company.
Cons: I do work a lot of hours, mostly by choice. I am rewarded well for my work. A little bit of adjustment needed to time zones. The company is PST and I am EST.

Review Title: A wonderful year with a great team and family
Pros: It's amazing how time flies, can't believe I've spent a whole year with all these wonderful people. A workplace that fees like home and a place where anyone would loved to be. I love their continue professional developments for their experts, great benefits package that allow you build your retirement, wonder team, everyone is willing to help whether you're a newbie or not, their respect for cultural and diversity. On the overall, Intuit is a great place to work.
Cons: Not at this time, still searching to see one.

Review Title: Best Company to Work For, Ever!
Pros: The company actually cares about their employees not just their customers. They make sure whatever is happening it will be fair.
Cons: A lot of changes come down the pike, sometimes I come across something that has change a previous day and I am just learning about it.

Pros: - Work hours that you would like with ability to change your schedule (select time) - Be a part of a team that supports each other - Pay is about average for a bookkeeper depending on your living area - Benefits are offered - Recognized for great work via monetary and non-monetary awards - Overtime offered for only select periods but is not required - Provided equipment with no cost to employee as long as employee has internet that can be hard wired into (no wifi allowed) - Career advancement is clear and offered, and can be discussed monthly/periodically with manager
Cons: - Select time employees, even if they work Full Time, are not considered Full Time Employees. Therefore the benefits offered to Full Time employees (Managers and above) are far greater than to Select Time employees that work 40 hour weeks. - Training is good but training makes it seem like all clients will be simple. Reality is that clients vary drastically and not everything can be covered in training that you can/will experience on a team. - There is no "ramp up" for work. As soon as you are placed on a team you can get 20-40 clients immediately. It can be daunting but you have support

Pros: Compensation is fair within market
Cons: hours can often be long

Pros: Outstanding benefits, lots of very smart people, I adore my team
Cons: Little focus on building durable internal solutions and all focus on external products - lots of legacy technology and technology debt. Operational excellence is not really observed outside of Customer Success teams. At higher levels, there is a lot of politics and jockeying for control of resources. (i.e., my influence is defined by the size of my org).

Pros:
- WLB
- Culture
- DT office
- Nice people
Cons:
Complex industry 
Slower pace/decision making
Stakeholder management

Pros: Perks used to be good, but had reduced
Cons: Politics in IDC is increasing by the day

Pros: Intuit does live the values on the website; benefits are top notch; pay and advancement opportunities.
Cons: Decisions have far too many stakeholders that need to sign off; decision making seems ad-hoc. Lots of "rah rah" meetings where everything is "awesome," "amazing," and "gamechanging."

Pros: Flexible schedule, end of season bonus, fully remote, & internet reimbursement
Cons:
Tech issues daily, leads who aren’t well versed in subject matter and can’t assist, emphasis on survey scores daily, and angry customers.

I felt as if I was bamboozled with the role and this feels more like an IT support role solving tech bugs more than it does a tax prep position.

Pros: Organized and a very structured company
Cons: Low pay with few opportunities to make more money

Pros:
Learning new technologies,
Great work life balance,
Great people,
Personal development,
You always feel highly appreciated.
Cons: I don't have any cons to add.

Pros: Lots of team work, steady work, benefits
Cons: Changing priorities, too busy at times, no paid holiday

Pros: Easy to fill personal details
Cons: Preferably log in in the beginning of the process

Pros: 1. Best in the industry benefits 2. Handsome RSUs - almost equivalent to your CTC with refresh every year
Cons: 1. No fast paced learning for PMs as compared to Indian companies. No cutting edge mobile product dev. 2. Highly tech focussed B2B projects that require very few product interventions. PMs are merely doing the job of project managers, most of the time. 3. Odd working hours, your personal life goes for a toss. Most of the meetings are held in the late evening (as late as 10:30pm) since you have to work as per US stakeholders. There are hardly any meting on US late nights like India  4. Since customers are based out of US, Canada, PMs hardly connect or participate in discovery process or identification of customer pain points. Most of the requirements actually come from the business team and PMs here have to just execute the same. 5. Whole focus is to distribute goodies, plan off-sites and other events and not care about employee job feedback, pain points. Employees are rewarded for posting good things on LinkedIn. My Advice is that if you want to be a very small fish in a big pond then only join the organization.

Review Title: Collaborative Culture but slow to move
Pros:
Collaborative culture, very helpful coworkers and employees
Respectful and open environment
Good WLB
Cons: Lots of bureaucracy and red tape to get things done

Pros:
I love that they give you all the tools and resources you will need to succeed.
People are generally very helpful!
Turnaround on escalated issues is pretty impressive.
I love the experience I am getting
Cons: The pay is not impressive at all compared to the market rate.

Review Title: Great work life balance, a bit slow moving, tech was behind industry standard a little bit
Pros: Work life balance is great. As long as you are getting your work done you can take an hour away, a day off etc.
Cons: Working in React, we weren't working with hooks or a few other industry standard practices.

Pros: Some of the most understanding and caring individuals you'll ever meet. Everyone is dedicated in their job, their career as well as their position within the company. The benefits are steller, non short on mental health, disability, as well as retirement/life insurance policies. They truly give you all the opportunity to succeed in this business.
Cons: Cost of living is still an issue. We are barely making the poverty line. They do not adjust for location, just the position it's self. AI seems to be driving the company rapidly into the future of data. It can be daunting to try and find your relevance among the fast moving development of tech and accounting.

Pros: Intuit has great Flexibility, benefits are awesome, team work is number one when it comes to working together to get the work done. Our leads and management are out of this world and will go above and beyond to help,
Cons: Only one I have is I wish we had some sort of short term disability plan.

Pros: Great pay and benefits, hybrid work.
Cons: Work life balance, poor use of hybrid policy, and poorly maintained code bases.

Pros: Pros are non existent with this company!!
Cons: The cons with this company are they are very unorganized they had two team leads give me totally different schedules after working one schedule for a month straight! They have training that last 3 weeks then they expect you to fully know how to navigate quickbooks online! They also make” business decisions “ where they fire multiple agents for no reason . So they basically don’t care about the people they hire because of course we all have lives to maintain !

Pros: Great teammates and good benefits
Cons: Upper management could use but more organizations and better planning

Pros:
1) Great benefits
2) Feeling of belonginess
Cons: 1) Career growth is flat

Review Title: Great company depending on what you're looking for
Pros:
Great benefits
Caring leaders
Smart colleagues / great network
Opportunities to grow if you know how to navigate the system
Cons:
Product org is becoming too layered
PMs not always empowered with the right tools / support
Some managers/teams are better than others 
Cumbersome process / redtape

Review Title: Good Company. Work life balance is as much as other organisations.
Pros:
- Happy environment in the organisation 
- Open to listening to grievances 
- Working on newer technologies 
- Working on Gen AI
Cons:
- Work Life Balance is not too much in most of the pillars. 
- Agile is not optimally adopted 
- Growth opportunities are limited

Pros:
Good work life balance
Everyone is great to work with
Cons: I don't have any cons for Intuit

Pros: great experts they really love the job, the more experienced m1's have been wonderfully helpful
Cons: very difficult to get experts to stay on to of their training and i cannot get in touch with my m2 have only had one 1:1 and nothing else

Review Title: Great Benefits but you will work hard for them and pay is low
Pros: hours are very flexible, lots of benefit and resources
Cons: juggling all the work your given and having time to use the resources and fulfilling your metrics

Pros: Great workplace and amazing culture
Cons: Nothing i can think of

Pros: Work hours are good and flexible, great environment
Cons: Can’t think of any cons

Pros: Solid company with great product & service offerings as well as great working environment
Cons: Management needs to streamline how company goals align with departmental & working team initiatives in order to minimize wasted resources

Pros: Supervisor was very supportive and knowledgeable. She has worked for the company for years and had a very positive attitude.
Cons: Getting stuck on calls at midnight.

Review Title: Strong Product line, but run like a cult.
Pros: Great product suite, smart recent purchases. Good work life balance, treated humanely.
Cons: Cult like culture. Did not witness a single performance-based promotion.

Pros: Most teams really live by the Intuit values. Incentives and perks are great.
Cons: Some departments don't disseminate best practices that may benefit the company as a whole. Need better transparency across some units.

Pros:
Bonus and stock is available 
Flexible schedule
Cons:
Management is always available 
Training is long

Pros:
-I love how much leaders support taking time for your family with a flexible hybrid workplace. As long as you get your work done and are a responsible employee, that's all that matter. 
-My leader is also really great with having frequent conversations about my career development and opportunities that peak my interest either on my team or rotation to another team. There seems to be a lot of opportunities to move from team to team.
-Perks and SOME compensation/benefits are really great. The people are also really wonderful to work with at Intuit. 
-I have only had a great experience with the people and culture. Everyone is willing to help each other which I feel is really special. I truly enjoy the people I work with.
-Although the times have changed when it comes to the level of site engagement and events on campus, site leaders are always looking to little fun ways to draw people back to the office and they have networking opportunities within Employee Resource Groups like (Intuit's Women's Network, Intuit Latinos Network, Intuit African Ancestry Network, and Intuit Pride Network)
-$1300 in wellness $ to use for almost anything when it comes to mental and physical health, 40 hrs paid volunteer time, 401k, ESPP, RSUs, Spotlight $ (which is peer to peer $ that we can give for above and beyond contributions), infertility benefits (IVF, etc), Back up child care 20 days allowance)
Cons: The base pay isn't that competitive compared to other large tech companies, but is still decent. There are also a lot of shifts in priorities, so you have to be able to be okay with pivoting FY to FY which doesn't allow you to go too deep into the strategies that you set.

Pros: Great benefits, good insurance and time off
Cons: Politic, less work life balance

Pros:
salary & stocks
goodies
free food at office
Cons:
mandatory layoff 7% every 6 months - 1 year
old school project and work 
managers who were hired last 2-3 years are bringing their toxic work culture back to Intuit - leading to a degradation of work culture, and lot of micromanagement
work life balance has become worst in last 1 year

Pros: Very supportive leadership that promotes well being and growth.
Cons: I don't really have anything bad to say about the team I worked with.

Pros:
Work life balance
Salary more than industry standards 
Best environment
Learning curve
Food
Commutation
Cons: Nothing to mention. It was very good

Review Title: A fine place to be if you want to work at a big company
Pros: Kind, smart people. Great benefits.
Cons: Large, bureaucratic company that is slow to get things done.

Pros: Great people and leadership, decent pay, lots of room for growth, benefits are great
Cons: If you get a role of inbound calls, the calls are back to back, so it is very high paced and can get overwhelming and feel like a grind.

Pros: exciting work, good perks, decent wlb
Cons: too many people, hard to get work done.

Review Title: Forced to work two positions. Make you feel "lucky" to be there.
Pros: The benefits are the only pro.
Cons: The work environment and culture are incredibly toxic. Claim to be diverse but are not. Forced to work two positions and only paid for one. Promised a position but went back on their word. Told me I was lucky to be there because of the benefits so I should be grateful. Manager played favorites with her friends that were on the team. Lied to my face multiple times.

Pros: Great culture and Team support
Cons: there's nothing negative I can share about my experience

Pros: Great place to work many opportunities
Cons: Great place to work and grow

Pros: Remote position. Benefits are adequate.
Cons: Management only focused on goals based on metrics. Customer service is no longer a priority. Company implements new procedures without training guidelines. AI is the new goal- eventually automating as many positions as possible. Holidays are not paid. Vacation accrued per pay period. Max accrual 5 days per year.

Review Title: work life balance and friendly cooperative environment
Pros: helpful colleagues, friendly managers, extremely flexible scheduling, bonus and pay incentives
Cons: some of the support staff (leads) really don't know enough to be up the chain when you need support with difficult issues

Pros: Yearly Quickbooks online certification training
Cons: - metrics driven workflow systems that do not  help bookkeepers complete their task effectively

Pros: Fair pay, good people, good training
Cons: inconsistencies and constantly changing procedures and rules

Pros: Senior level is very good, they support juniors
Cons: i am new to this organisation..

Pros: Awesome company to work for regarding salary and benefits
Cons:
No career growth oppty
Sr management doesn't know enough about role to help promote

Review Title: Not what it's cracked up to be.
Pros:
Remote work 
401k matching
Health Benefits
Cons:
-Lack of opportunities to grow.

-Racial discrimination is real here, most minorities feel that there is a lack of opportunity and that the majority has the advantage when opportunities are presented.

-This company boast inclusive but it's a pretty gift 🎁 that's empty. These words mean nothing. 

-The pay doesn't equal to the work as a Bookkeeper. You have several clients which makes it difficult to keep track.

-The QBO dept is very unorganized, they are constantly making changes. Which makes it difficult to do your job efficiently.

-Bi weekly pay, which limits cash flow, with an already tight competitive pay scale.

Pros: I get to work from home doing what I love, bookkeeping. Intuit is mindful of their employees and what their needs are. Intuit provides many perks that most companies do not provide to part time employees, like, paid vacation, 401K matching and Employee stock purchase option.
Cons: There are not enough hours in the day to work full time for Intuit as I balance running my own bookkeeping company.

Pros: Great opportunities. Awesome leadership. Good for engineers in tech role who are in early phases of career to give a solid growth in terms of overall craft, communication, ownership,
Cons: Depends greatly on which team you land in. And not the great place for overall work-life balance

Review Title: Innovative Company, Needs work on Culture
Pros: Great benefits and competitive compensation
Cons: Limited remote positions, changes in pay structure each year

Pros: The valuse in this company are second to none, and I feel very supported in my role by all the varied deparmtents at Intuit
Cons: I really don't have any cons. Intuit does a great job addressing concerns before they become cons.

Pros: Good hours and flex schedule
Cons: Leads are not that great

Review Title: Certain teams have lost sight of the customer for the sake of timelines.
Pros:
* Decent work/life balance
* Good Benefits
Cons:
* "Customer Obsession" has become mostly just hot air. Decisions are made based on a product we "need" to get out based on the word of a VP 5 levels above us, regardless of the quality and impact on tech debt.
* Back end teams are so disconnected from front end that it becomes almost impossible to resolve back end gaps.
* Obsession with modernizing means 3 separate back end architectures that do the same things but all have feature gaps due to a lack of attention to feature parity.
* You will get to a point where you will read customer feedback and won't feel like you can do anything but agree with it.

Pros: very good it is as I expected
Cons: Can be better for newly joinees

Review Title: Positive Work Environment and Growth Opportunities
Pros:
I've been with Intuit for over two years, and my experience has been overwhelmingly positive. The work culture is collaborative, fostering a sense of unity among team members.

Supportive Leadership: The management team is approachable and genuinely cares about employees' well-being. Regular check-ins and open communication channels make it easy to voice concerns.

Career Growth: Intuit prioritizes professional development. I've had the opportunity to attend various trainings and take on challenging projects that have significantly contributed to my skills and career growth.

Innovative Approach: Intuit encourages innovative thinking and values creative solutions. This has created an exciting and dynamic work environment.
Cons:
Workload: At times, workloads can be demanding, requiring effective time management. However, this can also be seen as a testament to the Intuit's commitment to excellence.

Communication Channels: While overall communication is strong, improvement in interdepartmental communication could enhance efficiency.

Pros: Good Company and work culture is very good.
Cons: no cons found as such.

Pros: It's the people! Supportive and collaborative culture, consisting of intelligent individuals who want to see each other succeed!
Cons: Meetings for the sake of meetings

Pros:
Working Remote
Supportive Staff
Great Training
Team Work Together
Cons: It gets busy around tax season.

Pros:
Excellent benefits. Health and dental and vision are all provided.

Mostly positive workplace culture. Yelling was rarely heard (in my department). 

Great pay. Ample vacation time. 

Campuses often have many things to do, and nice cafes for food. 

Co-workers are excellent and enjoyable to work with, with a high team spirit.
Cons:
For engineering, quantity is often valued over quality. If you simply do the tasks assigned to you, that may not be enough, so having to "find" extra work is required. Managers may not know how to delegate effectively, and this may result in unexpected termination with zero severance. 

Work outside of normal hours may be expected as well. This may include waking up to alerts at 3am and being expected to join calls until problems are resolved. Part of the industry, but can ruin vacations. And this isn't optional. (Or paid.) 

Management is decent, but often has substantial communication limitations. As well, due to different cultural backgrounds, questions may be asked that are personal and violate the law. They may also manage meeting time exceptionally ineffectively and allow for countless hours of wasted time to occur. In short: way too many pointless meetings. They try hard, but are often not trained properly. 

The company does want to force Return to Office policies a few days of the week, which often results in people working in near empty buildings, thereby requiring wasted time and gas commuting--only to be on Zoom at work.

Keep in mind that it's a tax software company. A lot of the work can become excessively dull over time. It can be very rewarding at times, but also incredibly boring as well. Again "tax software" isn't the most fun type of business.

Despite all this, the benefits do outweigh the cons. At least for a while. From what I experienced, many do put in a few years, and then move on.

Pros: Many learning opportunities, company values
Cons: not big enough compensations. the company doesn't raise salaries enough

Pros: Company has great benefits and pay. Very respectful co workers and management.
Cons: The work is tough and is very difficult. Large amount of knowledge to support the product is needed and lots of info silos. Going to be transferring customers a lot.

Review Title: The best company I have ever worked for!
Pros: I love the environment at Intuit. They really promote their values throughout the company with employee and with every goal the company has. I knew something was different about this company when on my second day I was faced with a difficult call and the lead support person asked me "what do you think you should do?" They don't micromanage and give you the freedom to have work life balance. The pay and benefits are great. Their is support at multiple levels if you have any trouble. Their is room for advancement and you can work from home.
Cons: Tax season can be stressful.

Pros: Great benefits and aim to provide a good culture.
Cons: If you are unlucky, you could b surrounded by a toxic team/people.
